clinical_study.brief_title: A PHASE 1 FEASIBILITY STUDY OF VOLUME INTRACARDIAC ECHO IN ASSESSMENT OF PATIENTS WITH STRUCTURAL AND VALVULAR HEART DISEASE UNDERGOING PERCUTANEOUS TRANSCATHETER THERAPY
clinical_study.official_title: A PHASE 1 FEASIBILITY STUDY OF VOLUME INTRACARDIAC ECHO IN ASSESSMENT OF PATIENTS WITH STRUCTURAL AND VALVULAR HEART DISEASE UNDERGOING PERCUTANEOUS TRANSCATHETER THERAPY

brief_summary.textblock: This study will compare 3 dimensional intracardiac echo (ICE) with 2 dimensional ICE or transesophageal echo in patients with structural and valvular heart disease who are already scheduled to undergo a percutaneous intervention. Specifically those patients would be those scheduled for a PFO or ASD repair, mitral balloon valvuloplasty, diagnostic cardiac catheterization assessment of aortic stenosis and those undergoing transcatheter aortic valve replacement.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective

study_pop.textblock: Patients with structural or valvular heart disease

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients in the study population referred to the cardiac catheterization laboratory for a percutaneous procedure to treat structural or valvular heart disease
Exclusion Criteria:
- Class IV CHF, inadequate femoral access, coagulation abnormalities, intracariac thrombus or DVT
